translated: Blessed One,🔽in that way, in the future, in many countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons, in the very same world realm called Endowed with the Banner of the Lofty Sālendra King, they will gradually attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, all in the same eon, the eon called Mahāvyūha.

translated: Then Mahādeva said to his two younger brothers,

original: kho bo'i snying 'jigs pas non na 'dir bdag cag gcan gzan gyis bsad du 'ong gi tshur shog /
analyzed: kho bo'i snying 'jigs pas non na 'dir bdag cag gcan gzan gyis bsad du 'ong gi tshur shog /
translated: “If my heart is oppressed by fear, we will be killed by wild animals here. Come!”

original: lha chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: lha chen pos smras pa /
translated: Mahādeva said,

original: bdag la 'jigs pa ni ma mchis na /
analyzed: bdag la 'jigs pa ni ma mchis na /
translated: “I have no fear,

original: skye bo sdug pa dang bral ba snyam bgyid pa'i snying du gyur to //
analyzed: skye bo sdug pa dang bral ba snyam bgyid pa'i snying du gyur to //
translated: but my heart is sad, thinking of being separated from my dear people.”

original: sems can chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: sems can chen pos smras pa /
translated: The great being said,

original: thub @492a *// pas bsngags pa'i nags khrod dben pa 'dir //
analyzed: thub @492a *// pas bsngags pa'i nags khrod dben pa 'dir //
translated: “In this isolated forest praised by the Sage,

original: bdag ni mi 'jigs mya ngan ma mchis kyi //
analyzed: bdag ni mi 'jigs mya ngan ma mchis kyi //
translated: I have no fear or sorrow.

original: shin tu rgyas mchog don chen rnyed snyam ste //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas mchog don chen rnyed snyam ste //
translated: Thinking I have found the most extensive, supreme, great meaning,

original: bdag gi snying 'di rab tu dga' bar gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi snying 'di rab tu dga' bar gyur //
translated: my heart is filled with joy.”

original: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de dag nags stag  po bcu gnyis po de dag gi khrod du rgyu ba na stag mo bu byung nas zhag bdun lon pa zhig bu lngas bskor te bkres shing skom pa'i nyam smad nas lus mchog tu nyam chung bar gyur
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de dag nags stag  po bcu gnyis po de dag gi khrod du rgyu ba na stag mo bu byung nas zhag bdun lon pa zhig bu lngas bskor te bkres shing skom pa'i nyam smad nas lus mchog tu nyam chung bar gyur
translated: Then, as those young princes were roaming in the midst of those twelve dense forests, they saw a tigress who had given birth seven days earlier, surrounded by her five cubs, emaciated from hunger and thirst, her body extremely weak.

original: pa de 'dra ba zhig mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa de 'dra ba zhig mthong ngo //
translated: I saw a woman like that.

original: mthong nas sgra chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: mthong nas sgra chen pos smras pa /
translated: Having seen her, Mahādeva said,

original: kye ma'o // nyon mongs ma 'di bu byung nas zhag drug gam /
analyzed: kye ma'o // nyon mongs ma 'di bu byung nas zhag drug gam /
translated: “Alas! This afflicted woman has given birth to a child,

original: zhag bdun lon par gyur la da ltar zas ma rnyed pas yang na ni rang gi bu la za bar 'gyur yang na ni bkres pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun lon par gyur la da ltar zas ma rnyed pas yang na ni rang gi bu la za bar 'gyur yang na ni bkres pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and after six or seven days, not finding food, she will either eat her own child or die of hunger.”

original: sems can chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: sems can chen pos smras pa /
translated: The great being said,

original: nyon mongs ma 'di'i zas ci /
analyzed: nyon mongs ma 'di'i zas ci /
translated: “What is the food of this afflicted woman?”

original: sgra chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: sgra chen pos smras pa /
translated: Mahādeva said,

original: 'di ltar gang sha sar pa dang / khrag dron po yod na de ni stag dang / dom dang / dred dang / seng ge rnams kyi zas yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang sha sar pa dang / khrag dron po yod na de ni stag dang / dom dang / dred dang / seng ge rnams kyi zas yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: “Thus, if there is fresh meat and warm blood, that is the food of tigers, bears, hyenas, and lions.”

original: lha chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: lha chen pos smras pa /
translated: The great god said,🔽“

original: 'dir nyon mongs bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / ldan pa'i lus su gyur pas srog gi lhag ma cung zad cig lus te rab tu nyam chung ba 'dis gnas 'dir zas skom tshol ni mi nus na 'di'i srog yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir su zhig rang gi lus yongs su gtong bar byed cig gu /
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / ldan pa'i lus su gyur pas srog gi lhag ma cung zad cig lus te rab tu nyam chung ba 'dis gnas 'dir zas skom tshol ni mi nus na 'di'i srog yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir su zhig rang gi lus yongs su gtong bar byed cig gu /
translated: Here, this body, which is afflicted with hunger and thirst, has only a little life remaining, and is extremely weak. Since it is unable to seek food and drink in this place, who would give up their own body to protect the life of this one?

original: sgra @492b chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: sgra @492b chen pos smras pa /
translated: Mahāpraṇāda said,

original: kye / rang gi lus yongs su btang ba ni bya dka' ba'o //
analyzed: kye / rang gi lus yongs su btang ba ni bya dka' ba'o //
translated: Oh! Giving up one's own body is difficult to do.

original: sems can chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: sems can chen pos smras pa /
translated: The great being said,

original: bdag cag lta bu srog dang / lus la mngon par chags pa blo chung ba rnams la ni tshul 'di bya dka' ba lags kyi gzhan lus yongs su gtong ba la zhugs pa gzhan la phan par brtson pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams la ni dka' ba ma lags so //
analyzed: bdag cag lta bu srog dang / lus la mngon par chags pa blo chung ba rnams la ni tshul 'di bya dka' ba lags kyi gzhan lus yongs su gtong ba la zhugs pa gzhan la phan par brtson pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams la ni dka' ba ma lags so //
translated: For those like us, who are of little intelligence and strongly attached to life and body, this method is difficult to do. But for the holy beings who have entered the practice of giving up their own bodies and strive to benefit others, it is not difficult.

original: yang / snying brtse snying rje las byung 'phags pa'i sems can dag /
analyzed: yang / snying brtse snying rje las byung 'phags pa'i sems can dag /
translated: Moreover, The noble beings who arise from compassion and love,

original: lha yul dang ni sa 'dir rang lus rnyed snyam ste //
analyzed: lha yul dang ni sa 'dir rang lus rnyed snyam ste //
translated: Thinking that he has found his body again in the heavenly realm or on earth,

original: gzhan gyi srog phyir mthun par dga' ba'i yid kyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog phyir mthun par dga' ba'i yid kyis ni //
translated: he is delighted and pleased to be in harmony with the life of others.

original: 'gyur ba med par 'dir ni rnam pa brgya yis rtse //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par 'dir ni rnam pa brgya yis rtse //
translated: Here he plays in a hundred ways without changing.

original: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de shin tu mi dga' ste stag mo de la mig mi 'dzums par ring zhig tu bltas nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de shin tu mi dga' ste stag mo de la mig mi 'dzums par ring zhig tu bltas nas song ngo //
translated: Then the young prince, with great sadness, looked at the tigress for a long time without blinking and left.

original: de nas sems can chen po 'di snyam du sems te da ni bdag gi lus 'di yongs su gtong ba'i dus la bab bo //
analyzed: de nas sems can chen po 'di snyam du sems te da ni bdag gi lus 'di yongs su gtong ba'i dus la bab bo //
translated: Then the Great Being thought this: “Now is the time to give away this body of mine.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig cing 'gyes pa'i chos can mthar 'gyed mtha' ngan pa //
analyzed: 'jig cing 'gyes pa'i chos can mthar 'gyed mtha' ngan pa //
translated: It is a thing that will break and fall apart, with a bad end and a bad conclusion.

original: rnag can lus 'di zas dang skom dang mal cha dang // bzhon pa 'os pa chen po dag gis ring bsrungs kyang //
analyzed: rnag can lus 'di zas dang skom dang mal cha dang // bzhon pa 'os pa chen po dag gis ring bsrungs kyang //
translated: This putrid body, though long protected with the best of foods, drinks, bedding, and vehicles,

original: snga med rang gis rang bzhin mi 'dor byas don med //
analyzed: snga med rang gis rang bzhin mi 'dor byas don med //
translated: has not obtained what is good for itself, not having abandoned its former nature.

original: yang thams cad du mi gtsang bar gyur bas na de'i 'tsho ba med kyi /
analyzed: yang thams cad du mi gtsang bar gyur bas na de'i 'tsho ba med kyi /
translated: Moreover, since it has become impure in every way, it has no life.

original: da bdag gis de las bzang po la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: da bdag gis de las bzang po la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Now I will apply myself to what is better than that.

original: de'i phyir bdag skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba'i gru bo che lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho las rgal ba'i gru bo che lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, I will become like a great ship for crossing the ocean of birth and death.”
Moreover,

original: snying po med lus dbu pa 'dra la srin bu brgyas gang byas pa chud gzon pa //
analyzed: snying po med lus dbu pa 'dra la srin bu brgyas gang byas pa chud gzon pa //
translated: “This body, which is like a head wound, filled with a hundred worms, is wasted away.

original: 'bras 'dra ba yi srid pa brgya ldan gcin dang phyi sas gang ba 'di btang ste //🔽mya ngan med cing 'gyur med phung med dri med bsam gtan la sogs yon tan gyis //
analyzed: 'bras 'dra ba yi srid pa brgya ldan gcin dang phyi sas gang ba 'di btang ste // mya ngan med cing 'gyur med phung med dri med bsam gtan la sogs yon tan gyis //
translated: I will give up this existence, which is like a fruit, filled with urine and excrement,🔽and attain the body of Dharma, which is filled with the qualities of non-sorrow, immutability, non-aggregateness, and purity, and so on,

original: kun tu gang ba'i chos sku yon tan brgyas gang rdul dang bral ba thob par bya;/
analyzed: kun tu gang ba'i chos sku yon tan brgyas gang rdul dang bral ba thob par bya;/
translated: which is filled with the qualities of the hundred merits, and which is free from dust.”

original: de snying rje mchog dang ldan pa'i snying du gyur pas de ltar brtul nas khyod gnyis gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: de snying rje mchog dang ldan pa'i snying du gyur pas de ltar brtul nas khyod gnyis gshegs su gsol /
translated: Having thus resolved, with a heart full of supreme compassion, he drove them away, saying, “You two go!

original: bdag ni rang gi bgyi ba zhig gi slad du nags stug po bcu gnyis su 'jug go zhes de gnyis bskrad do //
analyzed: bdag ni rang gi bgyi ba zhig gi slad du nags stug po bcu gnyis su 'jug go zhes de gnyis bskrad do //
translated: I am entering the twelve thickets of the forest for my own practice.”

original: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu sems can chen po nags 'dab de nas slar log ste stag gi gnas su song nas nags kyi yal ga la gos gzar te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu sems can chen po nags 'dab de nas slar log ste stag gi gnas su song nas nags kyi yal ga la gos gzar te /
translated: and made this aspiration:

original: bdag ni 'gro la phan phyir byang chub mtshungs pa med pa zhi ba thob 'dod de //
analyzed: bdag ni 'gro la phan phyir byang chub mtshungs pa med pa zhi ba thob 'dod de //
translated: I wish to attain the incomparable peace of enlightenment for the benefit of beings.

original: gzhan gyis btang bar dka' ba'i lus ni blo gros 'gyur ba med pa'i snying rjes sbyin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis btang bar dka' ba'i lus ni blo gros 'gyur ba med pa'i snying rjes sbyin //
translated: With unchanging compassion, I give away this body, which others find difficult to part with.

original: bdag gis skyon med byang chub rin med rgyal sras rnams kyis gnyer ba thob par shog /
analyzed: bdag gis skyon med byang chub rin med rgyal sras rnams kyis gnyer ba thob par shog /
translated: May I attain the priceless, faultless enlightenment sought by the bodhisattvas.

original: bdag gis srid pa'i rgya mtsho rab tu 'jigs las 'jig rten gsum po bsgral bar bya //🔽zhes smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: bdag gis srid pa'i rgya mtsho rab tu 'jigs las 'jig rten gsum po bsgral bar bya // zhes smon lam btab bo //
translated: May I liberate the three worlds from the terrifying ocean of existence.

original: de nas sems can chen po stag mo'i mdun du nyal ba dang / de nas byams pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la @493b stag mos ci'ang ma byas so //
analyzed: de nas sems can chen po stag mo'i mdun du nyal ba dang / de nas byams pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la @493b stag mos ci'ang ma byas so //
translated: Then the great being lay down in front of the tigress, and the tigress did not do anything to the bodhisattva, who was filled with love.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva,

original: kye ma'o // 'di ni nyam chung bas mi nus so snyam nas langs te snying brtse ba'i blo gros kyis mtshon cha btsal na gang nas kyang mtshon cha ma rnyed nas des 'od ma'i yal ga lo brgya lon pa sra ba zhig blangs te bdag gi mgul pa bcad nas stag
analyzed: kye ma'o // 'di ni nyam chung bas mi nus so snyam nas langs te snying brtse ba'i blo gros kyis mtshon cha btsal na gang nas kyang mtshon cha ma rnyed nas des 'od ma'i yal ga lo brgya lon pa sra ba zhig blangs te bdag gi mgul pa bcad nas stag
translated: Thinking, Alas! I am too weak to do this, he got up and, with a compassionate mind, searched for a weapon but could not find one anywhere. He took a branch of a hundred-year-old bamboo, cut his throat, and gave it to the tigress.🔽

original: mo'i mdun du 'gyel to //
analyzed: mo'i mdun du 'gyel to //
translated: He thought, Alas! This is too difficult for me, and he got up. With a mind full of compassion, he looked for a weapon, but he could not find one anywhere. He took a branch of a hundred-year-old bamboo, which was hard, cut his throat with it, and fell in front of the tigress.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'gyel ma thag tu chu'i dbus su son pa'i gru rlung gis bskyod pa bzhin du sa 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'gyel ma thag tu chu'i dbus su son pa'i gru rlung gis bskyod pa bzhin du sa 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva fell, the earth shook in six ways, like a ship in the middle of the ocean being tossed by the wind.

original: nyi ma'ang sgra gcan gyis zin pa bzhin du 'od zer rnams kyis mdzes pa med do //
analyzed: nyi ma'ang sgra gcan gyis zin pa bzhin du 'od zer rnams kyis mdzes pa med do //
translated: The sun lost its beauty, as if seized by Rāhu.

original: lha'i spos dang / phye ma dang 'dres pa'i me tog gi char yang bab bo //
analyzed: lha'i spos dang / phye ma dang 'dres pa'i me tog gi char yang bab bo //
translated: A rain of flowers mixed with divine incense and powders fell.

original: de nas lha zhig gis ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i yid kyis byang chub sems dpa' la bstod pa /
analyzed: de nas lha zhig gis ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i yid kyis byang chub sems dpa' la bstod pa /
translated: Then a god, with a mind full of wonder, praised the Bodhisattva:

original: blo gros bzang po khyod 'dir ji ltar thugs rjes sems can rnams khyab ste //
analyzed: blo gros bzang po khyod 'dir ji ltar thugs rjes sems can rnams khyab ste //
translated: “O you of good understanding, how is it that you pervade all beings with compassion?

original: mi yi dbang po rab tu dgyes pas ji ltar sku 'dir btang bas na //🔽skye ba dang ni 'chi ba'i don dang bral ba zhi ba gnas kyi mchog /
analyzed: mi yi dbang po rab tu dgyes pas ji ltar sku 'dir btang bas na // skye ba dang ni 'chi ba'i don dang bral ba zhi ba gnas kyi mchog /
translated: O Lord of men, how is it that you have given up your body out of joy?🔽“You have attained, without difficulty and in no long time, the highest abode of peace, the peace of purity,

original: zhi ba gtsang ma khyod kyis 'dir ni tshegs med ring por mi thogs brnyes //
analyzed: zhi ba gtsang ma khyod kyis 'dir ni tshegs med ring por mi thogs brnyes //
translated: which is free from the meaning of birth and death.”

original: de nas stag mo des byang chub sems dpa'i lus khrag gis sbags pa la bldags nas yud tsam gyis sha dang / khrag med par rus pa tsam zhig lus par byas so //
analyzed: de nas stag mo des byang chub sems dpa'i lus khrag gis sbags pa la bldags nas yud tsam gyis sha dang / khrag med par rus pa tsam zhig lus par byas so //
translated: Then the tigress, having licked the blood-soaked body of the Bodhisattva, in a moment left nothing but the bones, without flesh or blood.

original: de nas sgra chen pos sa g-yos pa de dag la bsams nas lha chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas sgra chen pos sa g-yos pa de dag la bsams nas lha chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Mahāpraṇāda, having reflected on those earthquakes, said to Mahādeva:

original: @494a *// ji ltar phyogs bcu'i rgya mtsho'i mthar thug rgya mtshor bcas pa yi //
analyzed: @494a *// ji ltar phyogs bcu'i rgya mtsho'i mthar thug rgya mtshor bcas pa yi //
translated: “How is it that this earth, with its oceans and islands, has trembled in the ten directions,

original: sa 'di rab tu g-yos shing nyi ma'ang 'od ni med gyur la //
analyzed: sa 'di rab tu g-yos shing nyi ma'ang 'od ni med gyur la //
translated: and the sun has lost its radiance?

original: me tog char pa par  cing kho bo'i yid kyang 'khrugs pas na //
analyzed: me tog char pa par  cing kho bo'i yid kyang 'khrugs pas na //
translated: The rain of flowers fell, and my mind was disturbed.

original: da gzod bdag gi nu bos rang gi lus ni btang yang dag /
analyzed: da gzod bdag gi nu bos rang gi lus ni btang yang dag /
translated: Now my younger brother has given up his body.

original: lha chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: lha chen pos smras pa /
translated: The great god said:

original: de ni ji ltar snying rje'i tshig smra la //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar snying rje'i tshig smra la //
translated: How can he speak such compassionate words,

original: bkres dang ldan zhing sdug bsngal brgyas gtses pa //
analyzed: bkres dang ldan zhing sdug bsngal brgyas gtses pa //
translated: When he is hungry and tormented by hundreds of sufferings,

original: shin tu nyam chung rang gi bu la yang //
analyzed: shin tu nyam chung rang gi bu la yang //
translated: And, being very weak, is about to eat his own son?

original: za bar chas la lta bas bdag kyang dogs //
analyzed: za bar chas la lta bas bdag kyang dogs //
translated: I am afraid to see this.

original: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de gnyis rab tu mya ngan gyis non nas mchi mas mig gang ste lam de nyid nas slar log nas stag mo'i drung du phyin pa dang / gos thams cad ni 'od ma'i yal ga la gzar /
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de gnyis rab tu mya ngan gyis non nas mchi mas mig gang ste lam de nyid nas slar log nas stag mo'i drung du phyin pa dang / gos thams cad ni 'od ma'i yal ga la gzar /
translated: Then the two young princes, overcome with great sorrow, their eyes filled with tears, turned back from that path and went to the tigress. They saw that all her fur had fallen out,

original: rus pa rnams ni bye zhing bral /
analyzed: rus pa rnams ni bye zhing bral /
translated: her bones were scattered and separated,

original: khrag ni rdzab tu gyur /
analyzed: khrag ni rdzab tu gyur /
translated: her blood had turned into mud,

original: skra ni phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su 'thor bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: skra ni phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su 'thor bar mthong ngo //
translated: and her hair was scattered in all directions.

original: mthong nas kyang brgyal te rus pa'i steng du 'gyel nas ring zhig lon pa dang / 'du shes rnyed de langs nas lag pa bsgred ste nyam thag pa'i sgra byung ngo //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang brgyal te rus pa'i steng du 'gyel nas ring zhig lon pa dang / 'du shes rnyed de langs nas lag pa bsgred ste nyam thag pa'i sgra byung ngo //
translated: Seeing him, they fainted and fell on his bones. After a long time, they regained consciousness, got up, and with their arms flailing, wailed piteously.🔽“Alas, my dear brother! Alas, my king!

original: kye ma'o nu bo sdug pa dang ni rgyal po dang // de bzhin du ni bu la rab tu gdung ba'i ma //
analyzed: kye ma'o nu bo sdug pa dang ni rgyal po dang // de bzhin du ni bu la rab tu gdung ba'i ma //
translated: And my son, whom I love so much!

original: padma 'dra ba'i mig ring khyod kyi gar bzhag ces //
analyzed: padma 'dra ba'i mig ring khyod kyi gar bzhag ces //
translated: Where are you, with your eyes like lotuses?”

original: ma ni bdag cag la yang tha chungs 'dri bar 'gyur //🔽kye ma bdag cag gnyis ni sa phyogs 'di nyid du //
analyzed: ma ni bdag cag la yang tha chungs 'dri bar 'gyur // kye ma bdag cag gnyis ni sa phyogs 'di nyid du //
translated: “Our mother will ask about the youngest one, too.”🔽“Alas, it would be better for us two

original: shi na @494b legs kyi gson na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: shi na @494b legs kyi gson na de lta ma yin no //
translated: to die right here on the ground,

original: sems can chen po med par gyur pas bdag cag la //
analyzed: sems can chen po med par gyur pas bdag cag la //
translated: than to live without that great being.

original: pha ma dag gis ji ltar lto ba ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: pha ma dag gis ji ltar lto ba ster bar 'gyur //
translated: How will our parents bear the loss of their child?”

original: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de gnyis kyis snying rje rje skad du rnam pa mang por dus nas dong ngo //
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu de gnyis kyis snying rje rje skad du rnam pa mang por dus nas dong ngo //
translated: Then the two princes wailed piteously in many ways and left.

original: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu'i rim gro ba rnams kyang gzhon nu tshol zhing phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su rgyug pa dang / gcig gis gcig mthong nas gzhon nu ga re /
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu'i rim gro ba rnams kyang gzhon nu tshol zhing phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su rgyug pa dang / gcig gis gcig mthong nas gzhon nu ga re /
translated: and seeing one another, asked, “Where is the prince?

original: gzhon nu ga re zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ga re zhes 'dri'o //
translated: Where is the prince?”

original: de'i tshe btsun mo mal na nyal ba'i rmi lam na sdug pa dang bral bar rmis pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe btsun mo mal na nyal ba'i rmi lam na sdug pa dang bral bar rmis pa /
translated: At that time, the queen, lying in bed, dreamed of being separated from her beloved.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It was like this:

original: nu ma gnyis bcad pa dang / so phyung ba dang / thi ba'i phru gu skrag pa gsum zhig rnyed pa las gcig khras khyer bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: nu ma gnyis bcad pa dang / so phyung ba dang / thi ba'i phru gu skrag pa gsum zhig rnyed pa las gcig khras khyer bar mthong ngo //
translated: She dreamed that her two breasts were cut off, her teeth fell out, and she found three frightened young pigeons, but one was carried off by a hawk.

original: de nas btsun mo sa g-yos pas snying dngangs te mod la sad nas sems pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas btsun mo sa g-yos pas snying dngangs te mod la sad nas sems pa la zhugs te /
translated: Then the queen, her heart frightened by the earthquake, immediately awoke and became anxious.

original: 'byung po'i rten ma rgya mtsho'i gos can 'di ni kun tu rab g-yo ci zhig gu /
analyzed: 'byung po'i rten ma rgya mtsho'i gos can 'di ni kun tu rab g-yo ci zhig gu /
translated: “What is this? The earth, the garment of the ocean, the abode of beings, is shaking everywhere.

original: nyi ma 'od zer med par gyur pas nga yi snying la mya ngan 'gyur bar ston //
analyzed: nyi ma 'od zer med par gyur pas nga yi snying la mya ngan 'gyur bar ston //
translated: The sun has become without light rays, showing that my heart will be filled with sorrow.”

original: nga yi lus ni zhum zhing mig kyang g-yo la rang gi nu ma bcad rmis pa //
analyzed: nga yi lus ni zhum zhing mig kyang g-yo la rang gi nu ma bcad rmis pa //
translated: My body is weak, my eyes are unsteady, and I have dreamed that I cut off my own breasts.

original: nga yi bu rnams nags khrod 'dir ni rtser dong ba la dge bar 'gyur ram ge /
analyzed: nga yi bu rnams nags khrod 'dir ni rtser dong ba la dge bar 'gyur ram ge /
translated: Will it be well with my sons, who have gone to play in the forest?

original: de nas de snyam bsams pa dang bran mo'ang snying myos te 'ongs nas btsun mo la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas de snyam bsams pa dang bran mo'ang snying myos te 'ongs nas btsun mo la smras pa /
translated: Then, as she was thinking thus, the slave-woman, her heart in a whirl, came and said to the queen:

original: jo mo gzhon nu'i rim gro pa dag gzhon nu tshol zhing mchis na jo co stor ces gda'o //🔽de skad ces thos ma thag @495a *//
analyzed: jo mo gzhon nu'i rim gro pa dag gzhon nu tshol zhing mchis na jo co stor ces gda'o // de skad ces thos ma thag @495a *//
translated: Lady, the attendants of the prince, searching for the prince, say that the prince is lost.

original: tu btsun mo'i snying 'dar zhing mig dang / gdong mchi mas gang ste rgyal po'i gan du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: tu btsun mo'i snying 'dar zhing mig dang / gdong mchi mas gang ste rgyal po'i gan du song nas smras pa /
translated: As soon as she heard this, the queen's heart trembled, and her eyes and face were filled with tears. She went to the king and said:

original: lha / bdag gi bu sdug pa stor ces thos so //
analyzed: lha / bdag gi bu sdug pa stor ces thos so //
translated: Your Majesty, I have heard that my dear son is lost.

original: rgyal po yang snying 'dar zhing shin tu myos te /
analyzed: rgyal po yang snying 'dar zhing shin tu myos te /
translated: The king, too, trembled and was greatly agitated.

original: kyi hud / bdag gi bu sdug pa dang bral ba lta zhes smras so //
analyzed: kyi hud / bdag gi bu sdug pa dang bral ba lta zhes smras so //
translated: He said: Alas, I am separated from my dear son!

original: de nas rgyal pos btsun mo dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir nga gzhon nu btsal ba la nan tan du byed kyi bzang mo mya ngan ma byed cig /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos btsun mo dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir nga gzhon nu btsal ba la nan tan du byed kyi bzang mo mya ngan ma byed cig /
translated: Then the king, in order to comfort the queen, said, “I will strive to find the prince. Do not grieve, Bhadra.

original: der gzhon nu tshol ba la zhugs pa na skye bo'i tshogs dag rong rong por gyur te de nas ring por ma lon par rgyal pos rgyal bu gzhon nu gnyis rgyang ring po nas 'ong ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: der gzhon nu tshol ba la zhugs pa na skye bo'i tshogs dag rong rong por gyur te de nas ring por ma lon par rgyal pos rgyal bu gzhon nu gnyis rgyang ring po nas 'ong ba mthong ngo //
translated: ” Then, as he was setting out to search for the prince, the people were all in an uproar. After a while the king saw the two princes coming from afar.

original: mthong nas kyang smras pa /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang smras pa /
translated: And when he saw them, he said,

original: gzhon nu de dag ni 'ong na thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhon nu de dag ni 'ong na thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: “The princes are coming, but not all of them.

original: kyi hud / bu dang bral ba lta zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: kyi hud / bu dang bral ba lta zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Alas, I am separated from my son.” This is suffering.

original: ji ltar bu dang bral bar gyur na yid ni mi bde ba //
analyzed: ji ltar bu dang bral bar gyur na yid ni mi bde ba //
translated: “How can the mind be unhappy when separated from a son?

original: mi rnams bu rnyed pa ni de ltar dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rnams bu rnyed pa ni de ltar dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: People are not so happy to get a son.

original: 'jig rten na ni gang dag bu med pa dang shi ba'am //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni gang dag bu med pa dang shi ba'am //
translated: “In the world, those who have no son, or whose son is dead,

original: mi rnams gang dag bu gson de dag bde ba yin nam ci //
analyzed: mi rnams gang dag bu gson de dag bde ba yin nam ci //
translated: or those who have a living son—are any of these people happy?

original: de nas btsun mo shin tu mya ngan gyis non nas rnga mo gnad du bsnun pa bzhin du shin tu mi bzad pa'i sgra phyung ngo //
analyzed: de nas btsun mo shin tu mya ngan gyis non nas rnga mo gnad du bsnun pa bzhin du shin tu mi bzad pa'i sgra phyung ngo //
translated: Then the queen, overcome with grief, let out a cry of anguish like an elephant struck in a vital spot.

original: de ltar bu gsum dag ni g-yog gi tshogs bcas te //
analyzed: de ltar bu gsum dag ni g-yog gi tshogs bcas te //
translated: So the three sons, with their retinue,

original: me tog rnams kyis gang ba'i nags khrod zhugs pa las //
analyzed: me tog rnams kyis gang ba'i nags khrod zhugs pa las //
translated: Having entered the forest grove filled with flowers,

original: bdag gi @495b bu dge tha chungs 'ongs par ma gyur na //
analyzed: bdag gi @495b bu dge tha chungs 'ongs par ma gyur na //
translated: my two elder sons have returned, but the youngest son has not come.

original: bdag gi snying dang 'dra ba'i tha chungs de ga re //
analyzed: bdag gi snying dang 'dra ba'i tha chungs de ga re //
translated: Where is that youngest son, who is like my heart?

original: de nas de gnyis lhags pa dang rgyal pos bu la dris pa /
analyzed: de nas de gnyis lhags pa dang rgyal pos bu la dris pa /
translated: Then the two sons arrived, and the king asked his sons,

original: khye'u tha chung ga re zhes gzhon nu gnyis la dris pa dang / de nas mya ngan gyis nyam thag cing mig mchi mas gang ste rkan dang / mchu dang / kha dang / so skams nas cang mi zer ro //
analyzed: khye'u tha chung ga re zhes gzhon nu gnyis la dris pa dang / de nas mya ngan gyis nyam thag cing mig mchi mas gang ste rkan dang / mchu dang / kha dang / so skams nas cang mi zer ro //
translated: Where is the youngest son? He asked the two young men, and then, overcome with grief, their eyes filled with tears, their palate, lips, mouth, and teeth dried up, and they said nothing.

original: btsun mos smras pa /🔽kho mo'i bu sdug tha chung de ga re //
analyzed: btsun mos smras pa / kho mo'i bu sdug tha chung de ga re //
translated: The queen said,🔽 Where is that youngest son, whom I love so much?

original: kho mo'i snying 'di gsal thug gyur cing //
analyzed: kho mo'i snying 'di gsal thug gyur cing //
translated: My heart is about to burst,

original: lus ni mi bzad rab tu gzir gyur te //
analyzed: lus ni mi bzad rab tu gzir gyur te //
translated: and my body is afflicted with unbearable pain.

original: kho mo 'drin pa nyams gyur myur du smros //
analyzed: kho mo 'drin pa nyams gyur myur du smros //
translated: Tell me quickly, lest my affection for her be lost.

original: de nas gzhon nu de gnyis kyis ji ltar gyur pa de zhib tu smras so //
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu de gnyis kyis ji ltar gyur pa de zhib tu smras so //
translated: Then the two young men related in detail what had happened.

original: de thos ma thag tu rgyal po dang / btsun mo myos par 'gyur te myos pa sangs nas snying rje rje skad du ngu zhing phyogs der dong ngo //
analyzed: de thos ma thag tu rgyal po dang / btsun mo myos par 'gyur te myos pa sangs nas snying rje rje skad du ngu zhing phyogs der dong ngo //
translated: As soon as the king and queen heard this, they became delirious. When they recovered from their delirium, they wept piteously and went to the place.

original: de nas rgyal po dang / btsun mos rus pa de dag sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa med cing skra phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su 'thor ba mthong nas shing rlung gis btab pa bzhin du 'gyel to //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po dang / btsun mos rus pa de dag sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa med cing skra phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su 'thor ba mthong nas shing rlung gis btab pa bzhin du 'gyel to //
translated: There the king and queen saw the bones, without flesh, blood, or sinews, the hair scattered in all directions, and fell down like trees struck by a storm.

original: de nas nye phan dang / blon po dag gis de ltar gyur pa de mthong nas chu dang / rim la ya'i tsandan gyi lde gus rgyal po dang / btsun mo'i lus bsil bar byas so //
analyzed: de nas nye phan dang / blon po dag gis de ltar gyur pa de mthong nas chu dang / rim la ya'i tsandan gyi lde gus rgyal po dang / btsun mo'i lus bsil bar byas so //
translated: Then the ministers and court physicians, seeing what had happened, cooled the body of the king and queen with water and sandalwood ointment.

original: de nas ring zhig lon pa dang / 'du shes rnyed nas rgyal po langs te snying rje rje slad du 'bod pa /
analyzed: de nas ring zhig lon pa dang / 'du shes rnyed nas rgyal po langs te snying rje rje slad du 'bod pa /
translated: After a long time, they regained consciousness. The king got up and lamented piteously:🔽Alas, my son, where have you gone, leaving me in this way?

original: kye ma bu sdug yid 'ong mthong dga' ba //🔽'chi bdag dbang du ci phyir de @496a *//
analyzed: kye ma bu sdug yid 'ong mthong dga' ba // 'chi bdag dbang du ci phyir de @496a *//
translated: “Alas, my dear son, so pleasant to behold,🔽why do you not quickly go to him?

original: myur song // 'chi bdag ci phyir nga la sngar ma 'ongs //
analyzed: myur song // 'chi bdag ci phyir nga la sngar ma 'ongs //
translated: Why did the Lord of Death not come to me first?

original: nga la sdug bsngal 'di las gzhan mi 'byung //
analyzed: nga la sdug bsngal 'di las gzhan mi 'byung //
translated: I shall have no other sorrow than this.”

original: btsun mo'ang myos pa las sangs nas skra gzhig cing lag pa gnyis kyis brang brdungs te nya thang la phyung ba bzhin du sa'i steng na 'gre ldog cing ma he be'u stor ba dang / rnga mo rde'u stor ba bzhin du snying rje rje skad du ngu'o //
analyzed: btsun mo'ang myos pa las sangs nas skra gzhig cing lag pa gnyis kyis brang brdungs te nya thang la phyung ba bzhin du sa'i steng na 'gre ldog cing ma he be'u stor ba dang / rnga mo rde'u stor ba bzhin du snying rje rje skad du ngu'o //
translated: The queen, having recovered from her swoon, disheveled and with her breasts torn by her fingernails, rolled about on the ground like a fish out of water, and wailed piteously like a cow that has lost her calf or a camel her young.

original: kye ma sdug cing gces pa'i bu ni padma 'di //
analyzed: kye ma sdug cing gces pa'i bu ni padma 'di //
translated: “Alas, my dear son, so pleasant to behold,

original: su yis sa yi steng du bshig nas rab tu gtor //
analyzed: su yis sa yi steng du bshig nas rab tu gtor //
translated: who has torn him to pieces and scattered him on the ground?

original: yid 'ong mig ldan zla 'dra'i bzhin can bdag gi bu //
analyzed: yid 'ong mig ldan zla 'dra'i bzhin can bdag gi bu //
translated: My son, with eyes like lotus petals, with a face like the full moon,

original: bdag gi dgra bo gang gis de ring sa 'dir bcom //
analyzed: bdag gi dgra bo gang gis de ring sa 'dir bcom //
translated: who has killed him here today, my enemy?

original: kye ma sa 'dir bu mchog bsad mthong na //
analyzed: kye ma sa 'dir bu mchog bsad mthong na //
translated: “Alas, seeing my excellent son killed here on the ground,

original: lus 'di ci phyir de ring zhig ma gyur //
analyzed: lus 'di ci phyir de ring zhig ma gyur //
translated: why does not my body break into a thousand pieces?

original: sdug bsngal 'di 'dra mthong yang ma gas pas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di 'dra mthong yang ma gas pas //
translated: Even seeing such suffering, I am not broken.

original: bdag gi snying 'di lcags ni yin yang dag /
analyzed: bdag gi snying 'di lcags ni yin yang dag /
translated: This heart of mine must be made of iron.

original: de ring rmi lam du ni bdag gi nu ma 'ga' zhig gis ni ral gris bcad //
analyzed: de ring rmi lam du ni bdag gi nu ma 'ga' zhig gis ni ral gris bcad //
translated: In my dream tonight, someone cut off one of my breasts with a sword.

original: so yang phyung bas de ring bdag gi bu sdug de ni myur du ma rung gyur //
analyzed: so yang phyung bas de ring bdag gi bu sdug de ni myur du ma rung gyur //
translated: And pulled out my teeth. Today my dear son will quickly be destroyed.

original: bdag gis thi ba'i phrug gu gsum zhig rnyed pa gcig 'dir ji ltar khras khyer bzhin //
analyzed: bdag gis thi ba'i phrug gu gsum zhig rnyed pa gcig 'dir ji ltar khras khyer bzhin //
translated: I found three young doves, and one of them was carried off by a hawk, just like this.

original: bdag gi bu gsum dag gis bskor ba las kyang gcig ni de ring 'chi bdag khyer //
analyzed: bdag gi bu gsum dag gis bskor ba las kyang gcig ni de ring 'chi bdag khyer //
translated: Of my three sons, today the Lord of Death will carry off one.

original: kye ma ho sdig pa can gyi rmi lam de yi 'bras bu grub pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: kye ma ho sdig pa can gyi rmi lam de yi 'bras bu grub pa 'di yin no //
translated: Alas! The result of that sinful dream has come to pass.

original: de nas rgyal po dang / btsun mo snying rje rje skad du rnam pa mang por smra zhing rgyan thams cad bkrol nas @496b skye bo'i tshogs chen po dang lhan cig tu bu'i rus bu la mchod pa byas nas gzhon nu'i rus pa rnams phyogs 'dir bzhag go /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po dang / btsun mo snying rje rje skad du rnam pa mang por smra zhing rgyan thams cad bkrol nas @496b skye bo'i tshogs chen po dang lhan cig tu bu'i rus bu la mchod pa byas nas gzhon nu'i rus pa rnams phyogs 'dir bzhag go /
translated: Then the king and queen, lamenting in many ways, removed all their ornaments, and together with a great crowd of people, made offerings to the prince’s bones. They placed the prince’s bones in this very place.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu gzhon nu sems can chen po zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du khyod sems na de de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu gzhon nu sems can chen po zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du khyod sems na de de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: if you think that the young prince Mahakashyapa at that time, on that occasion, was anyone else, you should not see it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu gzhon nu sems can chen po zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: nga nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal bu gzhon nu sems can chen po zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: I was the young prince Mahakashyapa at that time, on that occasion.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las yongs su ma grol ba de'i tshe'ang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las ngas 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan btags nas skyon thams cad dang bral te yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa da ltar lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las yongs su ma grol ba de'i tshe'ang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las ngas 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan btags nas skyon thams cad dang bral te yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa da ltar lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: when I was not yet liberated from desire, hatred, and ignorance, I benefited all beings by saving them from the sufferings of the hells and so forth. Now that I am perfectly enlightened, free from all faults, what need is there to mention my ability to benefit beings?

original: de ltar sems can re re'i phyir yang sems can dmyal ba rnams su bskal par gnas par spro zhing skye bo 'khor ba las rnam par bsgral lo //
analyzed: de ltar sems can re re'i phyir yang sems can dmyal ba rnams su bskal par gnas par spro zhing skye bo 'khor ba las rnam par bsgral lo //
translated: For the sake of each and every being, I rejoice in remaining in the hells for an eon, and I liberate beings from samsara.

original: sems can gyi snying pos shin tu bya dka' ba rnam pa sna tshogs du mas 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan btags so //
analyzed: sems can gyi snying pos shin tu bya dka' ba rnam pa sna tshogs du mas 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan btags so //
translated: The essence of sentient beings is extremely difficult to do, and in many ways it benefits all beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

analyzed: byang chub mchog 'di yongs su tshol ba na //
translated: Seeking this supreme enlightenment,

analyzed: bskal pa mang por ngas ni lus btang ste //

original: ji ltar rgyal po dang ni rgyal bur gyur //

translated: As a king and as a prince,

analyzed: de ltar ngas ni lus rnams yongs su btang //
translated: Thus I gave up my bodies.

original: sngon gyi skye ba rnams ni rjes @497a *//
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba rnams ni rjes @497a *//
translated: Recalling my past lives,

analyzed: dran te // shing rta chen po zhes bya'i rgyal po byung // de la bu ni gtong ba che ldan pa //
translated: There was a king named Maharatha.🔽He had a supreme son named Mahāsattva,

original: sems can che zhes bya ba dam pa yod //
analyzed: sems can che zhes bya ba dam pa yod //
translated: Endowed with great generosity.🔽He had two elder brothers,

analyzed: de la phu bo dag ni gnyis yod de; ;ming ni sgra chen po dang lha chen po //
translated: Named Mahāśabda and Mahādeva.

original: dpung tshogs de dag nags tshal stug por dong //
analyzed: dpung tshogs de dag nags tshal stug por dong //
translated: That army went to a dense forest,

original: de dag stag mo bkres pas gzir ba mthong //
analyzed: de dag stag mo bkres pas gzir ba mthong //
translated: And they saw a tigress tormented by hunger.

analyzed: di la sems can mchog de snying rje skyes; ;stag mo 'di ni bkres skom gzir bas na //
translated: ‘This tigress is tormented by hunger and thirst,

original: bdag bu de dag za bar 'gyur 'ong gis //
analyzed: bdag bu de dag za bar 'gyur 'ong gis //
translated: and will come to eat my sons.

original: de ltar bdag lus da ni gtang bar bya //
analyzed: de ltar bdag lus da ni gtang bar bya //
translated: Therefore, I will give up my body now.’

analyzed: shing rta che bu sems can che // stag mo bkres mthong stag phrug rnams //
translated: “The great being, the great prince,🔽saw the tigress, and out of compassion for the tiger cubs

original: thar bar bya phyir snying rje yis //
analyzed: thar bar bya phyir snying rje yis //
translated: in order to save them,🔽he jumped from the steep mountainside.

original: ri ngos gzar nas mchongs pa dang // sa ni ri dang bcas su gsol //
analyzed: ri ngos gzar nas mchongs pa dang // sa ni ri dang bcas su gsol //
translated: The earth shook with the mountain,

original: bya tshogs rnam mang rnam par 'thor //
analyzed: bya tshogs rnam mang rnam par 'thor //
translated: and the many flocks of birds were scattered.

original: ri dvags tshogs skrag 'jig rten 'di //
analyzed: ri dvags tshogs skrag 'jig rten 'di //
translated: The herd of deer were frightened, and the world

original: mun pas thibs por gnas par gyur //
analyzed: mun pas thibs por gnas par gyur //
translated: was enveloped in darkness.🔽“His two elder brothers, Mahādeva

original: de yi phu bo sgra chen dang // de bzhin lha chen de gnyis kyis //
analyzed: de yi phu bo sgra chen dang // de bzhin lha chen de gnyis kyis //
translated: and Mahānagna,

analyzed: nags mchog chen po der bltas na //
translated: looked out over the great forest,

original: sems can chen po ma rnyed nas //
analyzed: sems can chen po ma rnyed nas //
translated: but when they did not find the great being,

original: shin tu mya ngan zug rngu'i snying //
analyzed: shin tu mya ngan zug rngu'i snying //
translated: their hearts were pierced by the arrow of grief.

original: dran med nags kyi nang na rgyu //
analyzed: dran med nags kyi nang na rgyu //
translated: They wandered in the forest without consciousness.

original: nu bo de ni yongs tshol zhing //
analyzed: nu bo de ni yongs tshol zhing //
translated: “Searching for their younger brother,

analyzed: gdong la mchi zag nags khrod rgyu // sgra chen de bzhin lha chen po //
translated: And wandered in the forest, covered in tears.

original: rgyal bu gzhon nu de dag gnyis //
analyzed: rgyal bu gzhon nu de dag gnyis //
translated: The two princes, Mahādeva and Mahānagna,

original: stag mo nyam chung gar nyal ba //
analyzed: stag mo nyam chung gar nyal ba //
translated: Went to the place where the weak tigress was lying.🔽When they got there, they saw

analyzed: der ni nye bar song ba dang // stag mo dang ni stag @497b phrug gi / stag gi mchu la khrag chags mthong //

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po bar snang ji bzhin no //
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po bar snang ji bzhin no //
translated: Like the king of geese in the sky.

original: khyod kyi zhi zhal mtshams nas zla ba 'dra //
analyzed: khyod kyi zhi zhal mtshams nas zla ba 'dra //
translated: Your peaceful face is like the moon,

original: g-yas su 'khyil zhing khong chud 'dra ba lags //
analyzed: g-yas su 'khyil zhing khong chud 'dra ba lags //
translated: Coiling to the right and shining within.

original: bee d'urya 'dra'i @503a *//
analyzed: bee d'urya 'dra'i @503a *//
translated: Your hair is like a dark-blue gem,

original: spu 'od dkar rnams kyis //
analyzed: spu 'od dkar rnams kyis //
translated: Shining with white hairs

original: nam mkha'i dkyil na nyi ma lta bur mdzes //🔽gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil na nyi ma lta bur mdzes // gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
translated: Like the sun in the midst of the sky.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la bstod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste nyi shu pa'o ////
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la bstod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste nyi shu pa'o ////
translated: This concludes “Praise of All Tathāgatas,” the twentieth chapter of the Dharma teaching of “The King of the Genuine Dharma, the Marvelous Golden Light.”

original: de nas rigs kyi lha mo byang chub yang dag par bsdus pas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi lha mo byang chub yang dag par bsdus pas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva goddess of the clan, Samudgṛhīta-bodhī, at that time praised the Bhagavān with these verses:

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos la spobs pa'i blo mnga' ba //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos la spobs pa'i blo mnga' ba //
translated: “You have the intelligence of eloquence in the pure Dharma,

original: las ngan lam dang bral ba'i bdag nyid blo mnga' zhing //
analyzed: las ngan lam dang bral ba'i bdag nyid blo mnga' zhing //
translated: And you have the intelligence of a nature free from the path of bad actions.

original: srid dang srid min mkhyen pa rnam dag blo mnga' ba //
analyzed: srid dang srid min mkhyen pa rnam dag blo mnga' ba //
translated: You know what is and is not possible, and your mind is pure.

original: sangs rgyas rnam dag blo mnga' ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam dag blo mnga' ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha, whose mind is pure.

original: kye ma'o kye ma'o sangs rgyas gzi brjid mtha' yas te //
analyzed: kye ma'o kye ma'o sangs rgyas gzi brjid mtha' yas te //
translated: “Ah! Ah! The splendor of the Buddha is infinite.

original: kye ma'o kye ma'o rgya mtsho dang ni ri rab 'dra //
analyzed: kye ma'o kye ma'o rgya mtsho dang ni ri rab 'dra //
translated: Ah! Ah! He is like the ocean and Mount Meru.

original: kye ma'o kye ma'o sangs rgyas spyod yul mtha' yas te //
analyzed: kye ma'o kye ma'o sangs rgyas spyod yul mtha' yas te //
translated: Ah! Ah! The domain of the Buddha is infinite.

original: au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin du shin tu dkon //
analyzed: au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin du shin tu dkon //
translated: Like the udumbara flower, he is extremely rare.🔽“In order to guide all sentient beings,

original: sems can dag ni thams cad rjes su gzung slad du; ;gang gis mdo sde dam pa 'di 'dra rab gsungs pa //
analyzed: sems can dag ni thams cad rjes su gzung slad du; ;gang gis mdo sde dam pa 'di 'dra rab gsungs pa //
translated: The Lord of humans has taught this kind of supreme sūtra.

original: mi dbang nyi ma sh'akya'i dbang po'i rigs kyi tog /
analyzed: mi dbang nyi ma sh'akya'i dbang po'i rigs kyi tog /
translated: The sun of the Śākya clan, the crest jewel,

original: kye ma'o kye ma'o de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje ldan //
analyzed: kye ma'o kye ma'o de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje ldan //
translated: “Ah! Ah! The Tathāgata is compassionate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya'i thub pa dbang po zhi //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya'i thub pa dbang po zhi //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Śākya sage, has pacified the senses.

original: zhi ba'i dam pa zhi ba'i grong khyer rab tu zhugs //
analyzed: zhi ba'i dam pa zhi ba'i grong khyer rab tu zhugs //
translated: He has entered the supreme peace, the city of peace.

original: ting 'dzin zab cing zhi la rdul dang bral ba ni //
analyzed: ting 'dzin zab cing zhi la rdul dang bral ba ni //
translated: “The profound, peaceful, and stainless samādhi

original: rgyal ba sangs rgyas @503b spyod yul der yang rab tu zhugs //
analyzed: rgyal ba sangs rgyas @503b spyod yul der yang rab tu zhugs //
translated: And they have entered the domain of the victorious buddhas.

original: de ltar nyan thos rnams kyi lus ni stong pa ste //
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos rnams kyi lus ni stong pa ste //
translated: Thus, the bodies of the hearers are empty,

original: rkang gnyis dam pa rnams kyi gnas pa'ang stong pa lags //
analyzed: rkang gnyis dam pa rnams kyi gnas pa'ang stong pa lags //
translated: And the abodes of the sublime humans are also empty.

original: chos rnams de dag thams cad rang bzhin stong lags na //
analyzed: chos rnams de dag thams cad rang bzhin stong lags na //
translated: All these phenomena are empty by nature,

original: sems can rnams ni stong pa'i bdag nyid ma 'tshal to //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni stong pa'i bdag nyid ma 'tshal to //
translated: But sentient beings do not understand the nature of emptiness.

original: rtag pa ther zug tu ni rgyal ba dran par bgyid //
analyzed: rtag pa ther zug tu ni rgyal ba dran par bgyid //
translated: They remember the Victorious One as being permanent and stable,

original: rgyal ba mthong bar yang ni rtag tu mya ngan bgyid //
analyzed: rgyal ba mthong bar yang ni rtag tu mya ngan bgyid //
translated: And they are always sad at the thought of not seeing the Victorious One.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma mthong bar bgyid slad du //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma mthong bar bgyid slad du //
translated: In order to see the sun of perfect buddhahood,

original: rtag par yang ni smon lam rab tu 'debs par bgyid //
analyzed: rtag par yang ni smon lam rab tu 'debs par bgyid //
translated: They constantly make aspirations.

original: bdag ni rtag tu dog sar pus mo btsugs nas su //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag tu dog sar pus mo btsugs nas su //
translated: They always kneel on the ground,

original: rgyal ba'i gzugs kyis skom pa'i mya ngan rab tu sems //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i gzugs kyis skom pa'i mya ngan rab tu sems //
translated: And are sad at the thought of thirsting for the Victorious One’s form.

original: 'dren pa'i slad du snying rje'i skad kyis ngu bar bgyid //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i slad du snying rje'i skad kyis ngu bar bgyid //
translated: They cry out with cries of compassion for the sake of the guide.

original: bdag ni bde bar gshegs pa mthong bar rab tu skom //
analyzed: bdag ni bde bar gshegs pa mthong bar rab tu skom //
translated: I am thirsty to see the Sugata.

original: mya ngan me yis kun tu rab tu 'bar bar gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan me yis kun tu rab tu 'bar bar gyur //
translated: I am burning in the fire of sorrow.

original: mthong ba'i chu bsil bdag la rtag par stsal du gsol //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chu bsil bdag la rtag par stsal du gsol //
translated: Please always give me the cool water of seeing.

original: bdag ni khyod kyi gzugs la blta bas rab tu skom //
analyzed: bdag ni khyod kyi gzugs la blta bas rab tu skom //
translated: I am thirsty to see your form.

original: thugs rje'i char gyis bdag la rab tu sim par mdzod //
analyzed: thugs rje'i char gyis bdag la rab tu sim par mdzod //
translated: Satisfy me with the rain of compassion.

original: 'dren pa khyod kyis bdag la thugs rje mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: 'dren pa khyod kyis bdag la thugs rje mdzad du gsol //
translated: Please have compassion for me, O Guide.

original: zhi ba'i gzugs mthong ba ni bdag la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gzugs mthong ba ni bdag la stsal du gsol //
translated: Please give me the sight of your peaceful form.

original: khyod ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba skyob pa ste //
analyzed: khyod ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba skyob pa ste //
translated: You are the protector of the world with its gods.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos rnams kyi lus ni stong pa lags //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos rnams kyi lus ni stong pa lags //
translated: Thus the bodies of the śrāvakas are empty.

original: sems can thams cad dag ni rmi lam rang bzhin te //🔽nam mkha' 'dra zhing nam mkha'i @504a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad dag ni rmi lam rang bzhin te // nam mkha' 'dra zhing nam mkha'i @504a *//
translated: All beings are of the nature of dreams.🔽Like space,

original: ngo bo nyid kyang lags //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang lags //
translated: they have the nature of space.

original: sgyu ma smig rgyu dang ni chu yi zla ba 'dra //
analyzed: sgyu ma smig rgyu dang ni chu yi zla ba 'dra //
translated: Like illusions, mirages, and the moon in water,

original: 'dren pa khyod kyis ston pa tshe dang ldan pa lags //
analyzed: 'dren pa khyod kyis ston pa tshe dang ldan pa lags //
translated: you, the Guide, are the teacher, O Long Living One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdan las bzhengs te tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdan las bzhengs te tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One rose from his seat and spoke in a voice like Brahmā’s:

original: rigs kyi lha mo khyod legs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi lha mo khyod legs so //
translated: “Noble goddess, you are excellent!

original: khyod yang legs so //
analyzed: khyod yang legs so //
translated: You are excellent indeed!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas rigs kyi lha mo byang chub yang dag par bsdus pa dang / lha mo chen mo dbyangs can la sogs pa lha yi bu mo de dag thams cad dang / lha mo chen mo dpal la la sogs pa lha mo'i tshogs de dag thams cad dang /🔽rnam thos kyi bu la sogs pa lha'i rgyal po de dag thams cad dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang; lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas rigs kyi lha mo byang chub yang dag par bsdus pa dang / lha mo chen mo dbyangs can la sogs pa lha yi bu mo de dag thams cad dang / lha mo chen mo dpal la la sogs pa lha mo'i tshogs de dag thams cad dang / rnam thos kyi bu la sogs pa lha'i rgyal po de dag thams cad dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang; lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, the noble goddess Gathering of Bodhisattvas, the goddess Sarasvatī, and all the other celestial maidens, the goddess Śrī Mahādevī and all the other goddesses,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: the god-king Vaiśravaṇa and all the other god-kings, the entire retinue, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced and praised the words of the Blessed One.

original: gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po las /
translated: This concludes “The King of Glorious Sutras, the Sublime Golden Light,”

original: mjug sdud pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
analyzed: mjug sdud pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
translated: Chapter 21: The Concluding Chapter

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so //
translated: The noble Great Vehicle sūtra, the King of Glorious Sutras, the Sublime Golden Light, is complete.
